title: Judge Rules Trump Admin Unlawfully Froze Harvard Grants; White House to Appeal
snippets: The ruling is a legal victory for Harvard but the White House says it will appeal the decision.
A court rules the Ivy League college's free speech rights were violated, but the White House vows to appeal.
The Trump administration in April froze grants to Harvard University over concerns about antisemitism on the Ivy League campus and other concerns.
Harvard is the only prestigious university that has sued over antisemitism allegations lobbed by the Trump administration after on-campus pro-Palestinian protests in 2024.
titles: Trump administration illegally froze billions in Harvard funds, judge rules
Judge overturns Trump administration funding cuts to Harvard
Judge voids $2.2 billion Harvard funding freeze by Trump administration
Trump Administration’s $2.2 Billion Harvard Funding Freeze Ruled Unconstitutional
summary: A judge ruled that the Trump administration unlawfully violated Harvard University's free speech rights by freezing $2.6 billion in grants due to concerns over antisemitism and other issues. This decision marks a legal win for Harvard, which is the only Ivy League school to sue the administration following allegations of antisemitism after pro-Palestinian protests on campus. However, the White House has announced plans to appeal the ruling.

title: Auger-Aliassime Beats de Minaur to Reach US Open Semifinals
snippets: Top-seed Jannik Sinner cruised through the semifinals, losing only seven games to Italian compatriot Lorenzo Musetti.
World No 1 Jannik Sinner surged into the US Open semi-finals against Felix Auger-Aliassime after another dominant display at Flushing Meadows.
The Canadian knocked off No. 8 seed Alex de Minaur of Australia 4-6, 7-6, 7-5, 7-6 to reach the semifinals of the Grand Slam tournament.
Canada’s Felix Auger-Aliassime explains his mentality to persevere through a long match against Alex de Minaur and his focus on preparing for the US Open semifinals.
Watch as Canada’s Felix Auger-Aliassime defeats Australia’s Alex de Minaur after a four-hour bout to advance to the US Open semifinals.

Félix Auger-Aliassime has passed another big test at the US Open. The Canadian knocked off No. 8 seed Alex de Minaur of Australia 4-6, 7-6 (7), 7-5, 7-6 (4) to reach the semifinal of the Grand Slam tournament. It is the first time since 2021 that Auger-Aliassime, who improved to 3-1 against de Minau
titles: US Open: Sinner dominates Musetti to set up semifinal with Auger-Aliassim
Scintillating Sinner surges into US Open semi-final against Auger-Aliassime
Canada’s Auger-Aliassime beats de Minaur, to face Sinner in US Open semifinals
‘It’s not over’: Canada’s Auger-Aliassime focused on US Open semifinals
Auger-Aliassime upsets de Minaur to advance to US Open semifinals
Canada’s Félix Auger-Aliassime punches ticket to US Open semifinal
summary: Félix Auger-Aliassime defeated No. 8 seed Alex de Minaur 4-6, 7-6, 7-5, 7-6 to reach the US Open semifinals after a four-hour match. This victory marks Auger-Aliassime's advancement to his first Grand Slam semifinal since 2021, improving his head-to-head record against de Minaur to 3-1.

title: U.S. Appeals to Supreme Court to Uphold Trump's Tariffs
snippets: The government called on the court to reverse an appeals court ruling that found most of President Donald Trump's tariffs are an illegal use of an emergency powers law.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMidkFVX3lxTFBXaGhIRjRzdmgtOEIxSW9EZ2tUX0VaaEJwaUlGWVl1SUpaVHI3WHNlVXJjOTk5dDIzbGpnWWRzLUNPMzdSUElCQWtvLThfeXhNbjcyeVM0VFFRT2Q4dmtNaDdNZExhdTdSX1lobGhPT01hTWJSZUE?oc=5" target="_blank">Trump administration files appeal to Supreme Court to keep tariffs i
The fate of most of President Trump's tariffs are at stake in the appeal, which seeks to overturn lower-court rulings finding he usurped Congress' authority.
titles: Trump asks Supreme Court to reverse tariffs ruling finding them illegal
Trump administration files appeal to Supreme Court to keep tariffs in place - Axios
Trump asks Supreme Court to quickly hear appeal to save his tariffs
summary: The U.S. government has appealed to the Supreme Court to overturn a lower court's decision that deemed most of President Donald Trump's tariffs illegal, arguing they were an improper use of emergency powers. This move seeks to preserve the tariffs, challenging the prior ruling that Trump overstepped Congress' authority.

title: Lisbon Funicular Derailment Kills 15, Injures 18 in Tragic Accident
snippets: Crash of the historic Elevador da Gloria funicular is one of Lisbon’s deadliest transport accidents in years.
At least 15 people were killed and 18 more injured when the iconic funicular derailed in the Portuguese capital. The precise cause of the accident remains unclear.
Lisbon’s funiculars — a type of cable car running on rails up and down a steep slope — are a popular tourist destination in the city.
The funicular line, one of three in Lisbon, is a popular tourist attraction.
titles: At least 15 killed as funicular railcar derails in Portugal’s Lisbon
Portugal: At least 15 dead in Lisbon funicular accident
15 killed, 18 injured after Lisbon’s popular Glória funicular derails
At Least 15 Dead After Lisbon Funicular Derails and Crashes, Officials Say
summary: A funicular derailment in Lisbon resulted in at least 15 deaths and 18 injuries, marking one of the city's deadliest transport accidents in years. The incident involved the historic Elevador da Gloria, a popular tourist attraction. Lisbon's mayor declared it a tragic moment for the city, and a day of mourning has been announced.

title: NFL's Goodell Open to Taylor Swift Super Bowl Show, No Talks Confirmed
snippets: <a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMigAFBVV95cUxQRWszbkRXT2VqTHRSV2F4a215WmktenVNVjZMa211STlRNEpveEw5X2JJdnRhbjR4VE81R0d3eUZhakdyVWM2dGtqMy1WQkczSGtoLXdvbTlWaF9maXB6Z195VUhQZEZ0MlVZbjA0ano3Ri1NaWpzeTZ2VWs4clVaYw?oc=5" target="_blank">Taylor Swift Super Bowl halftime not ruled out by NFL
"It's a maybe," NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell said of the chances of Taylor Swift performing at next year's Super Bowl halftime show.
The tantalising prospect of Taylor Swift performing at the Super Bowl half-time show in February is a 'maybe', according to NFL commissioner Roger Goodell.
Appearing on the TODAY show Wednesday morning, NFL commissioner Roger Goodell addressed the possibility of pop star Taylor Swift performing the halftime show at Super Bowl LX.
titles: Taylor Swift Super Bowl halftime not ruled out by NFL commissioner - Axios
NFL commissioner says Taylor Swift would be 'welcome at any time' on the Super Bowl halftime stage
Taylor Swift to play Super Bowl show? NFL commissioner says 'maybe'
Goodell says Taylor Swift performing Super Bowl halftime show a ‘maybe’
summary: NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell did not confirm any official discussions regarding Taylor Swift performing at the Super Bowl halftime show but expressed that the NFL would be thrilled to have her. Despite the lack of confirmation, fan speculation is high, with some pointing to cryptic references in Swift's work as hints she might be the next performer.

title: Alex Matthews to Captain England vs Australia in World Cup Pool Match
snippets: Number eight Alex Matthews will captain England against Australia in their final Rugby World Cup pool match on Saturday.
Matthews, a 2014 World Cup winner, leads the side in the continued absence of skipper Zoe Aldcroft as England seek top spot in Pool A

• Victory would cement England’s position at top of Pool A

  • Jess Breach will win 50th cap on the left wing in Brighton

Alex Matthews will captain England for only the second time in her career in their final pool match of the Rugby World Cup against Australia,
titles: Matthews to captain England against Australia
Alex Matthews to captain England against Australia as Jess Breach wins 50th cap in Women’s World Cup
Alex Matthews to captain England in final World Cup pool game against Australia
summary: Alex Matthews will captain England in their final Rugby World Cup pool match against Australia, aiming for a victory to secure the top spot in Pool A. This marks her second captaincy in her career. The match also features Jess Breach winning her 50th cap. England is playing without regular skipper Zoe Aldcroft.

title: Florida Lawmakers to Vote on Ending School Vaccine Mandates
snippets: Florida lawmakers will vote whether to repeal a law that requires children to receive vaccines for polio, diphtheria, measles, and mumps before entering school.
The move would make Florida the first U.S. state to withdraw from mandates credited with boosting vaccination rates and preventing infectious disease outbreaks.
Exposing vulnerable people to vaccine-preventable disease is just part of life, Ladapo said.
titles: Florida working to end vaccine mandates
Florida to become first state to end all vaccine mandates, including in schools
In win for infectious diseases, Florida to end all school vaccine requirements
summary: Florida lawmakers are set to vote on repealing a law mandating vaccines for schoolchildren against diseases like polio and measles. Critics label the plan a public health risk, while Florida could become the first state to eliminate such mandates. Joseph Ladapo, known for his vaccine skepticism, supports the repeal, stating exposure to vaccine-preventable diseases is a part of life.

title: American Eagle Sees Surge in Sales, Credits Sweeney and Kelce Campaigns
snippets: The US actress was part of the company's controversial "Great Jeans" campaign which drew a backlash.
American Eagle said its Sydney Sweeney campaign is its best ever, leading to positive gains in new customers, sales and foot traffic.
American Eagle stock surged as the company reported that Sydney Sweeney's jeans campaign and Travis Kelce's new collection were successes.
titles: American Eagle shares soar as Sydney Sweeney ads seen driving sales
American Eagle stock soars 20% as retailer says Sydney Sweeney campaign is 'best' to date, beats earnings
American Eagle's stock is soaring as Sydney Sweeney and Travis Kelce's star power jolts sales
summary: American Eagle reported significant positive impacts from its promotional campaigns featuring Sydney Sweeney and Travis Kelce, including an increase in new customers, sales, and foot traffic. The company's stock surged following the announcement of better-than-expected same-store sales forecasts, attributed to the successful marketing efforts.

title: Deputy PM Rayner Admits to Stamp Duty Error, Faces Ethics Review
snippets: Angela Rayner's admission that she underpaid stamp duty on her flat in Hove dominates Thursday's papers.
Deputy prime minister faces hefty stamp duty bill as she waits for government ethics adviser to rule on affair

Deputy prime minister expresses regret over mistake that led to underpayment of stamp duty on £800,000 flat

Angela Rayner is battling for her political survival after she admitted underpaying stamp duty on her £800,000 seaside flat and referred herself to the ministerial ethics adviser afte
titles: Rayner 'clings on' as she 'fights for political survival'
Angela Rayner fights for political survival after property tax admission
Rayner battling for political survival after referring herself to ethics adviser
summary: Angela Rayner, the Deputy Prime Minister, admitted to underpaying stamp duty on her £800,000 flat in Hove and has referred herself to the government's ethics adviser. She expressed regret over the mistake and now faces a hefty bill. The affair dominates headlines as Rayner battles for her political survival.

title: US Military Strike Kills 11 on Venezuelan Boat, Raises Regional Concerns
snippets: US threats of expanding military attacks across Latin America have alarmed some regional leaders, including in Mexico.
President Donald Trump has justified the US military's lethal strike on a boat allegedly owned by a Venezuelan gang. Meanwhile, top US officials have vowed to continue the strikes.
The administration has not provided a legal authority or justification for the attack Tuesday that killed 11 people.
titles: US will bomb more vessels suspected of drug smuggling, Rubio says
US says attacks on suspected drug boats will happen again
Trump ordered strike on suspected drug boat to send a message, Rubio says
summary: The US, under President Trump, conducted a military strike on a boat owned by a Venezuelan gang, killing 11 people. This action, part of a broader threat to expand military attacks in Latin America, has raised concerns among regional leaders, including Mexico. The US administration has yet to provide a legal justification for the attack.

title: Anisimova Defeats Swiatek in US Open Quarter-Finals, Advances to Semis
snippets: Amanda Anisimova says she rewatched her Wimbledon final defeat by Iga Swiatek to inspire her to victory over the second seed in the US Open quarter-finals.
Fewer than two months ago, Swiatek bested Anisimova in the Wimbledon final 6-0, 6-0. On Wednesday, Ansimova got her revenge.
Anisimova had plenty of motivation on Wednesday to advance to the semifinals in New York
titles: How rewatching 'painful' Wimbledon final inspired Anisimova to beat Swiatek
The ultimate upset: How Amanda Anisimova beat Iga Swiatek
US Open 2025 results: Amanda Anisimova upsets No. 2 Iga Swiatek to reach semifinals after Wimbledon disaster
summary: Amanda Anisimova avenged her Wimbledon final defeat to Iga Swiatek by beating the second seed in the US Open quarter-finals. Less than two months after losing 6-0, 6-0 to Swiatek, Anisimova used the loss as motivation to win and advance to the semifinals in New York.

title: Lisbon Funicular Derailment Kills 15, Injures 18
snippets: At least 15 people died after a car on Lisbon's famous funicular railway derailed and crashed.
A Lisbon streetcar, one of the city’s major tourist attractions, derailed on Wednesday, leaving 15 dead and 18 injured.
At least 15 people were killed after the Glória funicular, one of the city’s most popular tourist attractions, derailed and crashed.
titles: How did Lisbon's iconic funicular derail? What we know so far
Lisbon’s Gloria funicular derails: What we know about the cause and victims
Lisbon Funicular Crash: What to Know About Cause and Victims
summary: A tragic incident occurred in Lisbon when the Glória funicular, a major tourist attraction, derailed and crashed, resulting in at least 15 fatalities and 18 injuries. This event took place on Wednesday.

title: Putin, Xi Discuss Immortality Through Organ Transplants in Leaked Chat
snippets:
Live footage of private conversation between Russian president and Chinese leader aired at Beijing military parade

The authoritarian strongmen Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping have mused on how organ transplants might lead to immortality, during a brief exchange of small talk caught on a hot m
Medical advances and geopolitics collide for two septuagenarian leaders who have suggested that their time in office is far from over.
What do warmongers and strongmen chat about? Living forever, of course.
titles: Hot mic catches Putin and Xi discussing organ transplants and immortality
In a ‘Hot Mic’ Moment, Xi and Putin Muse About Immortality and Organ Transplants
Putin: “Immortality” coming soon through continuous organ transplants
summary: During a Beijing military parade, a live broadcast captured a private conversation between Russian President Vladimir Putin and Chinese Premier Xi Jinping, who have been in power for 25 and 13 years respectively. They speculated on the possibility of living forever through organ transplants, amidst discussions on medical advances and their prolonged tenures in office. This exchange highlights their interest in immortality and suggests their intention to remain in power indefinitely.

title: Nidec Corp. Shares Plunge 22% Amid Accounting Scandal Concerns
snippets: This marks the Japanese electronics components manufacturer's biggest one-drop.
Nidec Corp.’s shares plunged a record 22% after the Japanese company found evidence that senior executives may have been involved in a number of accounting issues at subsidiaries.
titles: Nidec shares plunge 22% as China unit probe finds accounting issues tied to management
Nidec Shares Sink 22% on Fears of Systemic Accounting Issues
summary: Nidec Corp., a Japanese electronics components manufacturer, saw its shares plummet by a record 22% following the discovery of potential accounting irregularities involving senior executives at its subsidiaries.

title: Judge Rules Trump Admin Unlawfully Cut $2.2B Funding to Harvard
snippets: The decision is a victory for the Ivy League university, which has been locked in a months-long feud with Trump.
Harvard has scored a legal victory against the White House as a federal judge overturned the Trump administration's decision to cut the university's funding by billions of dollars.
titles: US judge rules Trump unlawfully cut Harvard University research grants
US judge rules Trump unlawfully canceled Harvard's grants
summary: A federal judge ruled that the Trump administration unlawfully terminated approximately $2.2 billion in funding to Harvard University, marking a significant legal victory for the institution. This decision comes after a prolonged dispute, where the White House accused Harvard of failing to address harassment of Jewish students. The ruling overturns the administration's funding cut, supporting Harvard's stance in the feud.

summary: Naomi Osaka reached her first Grand Slam semifinal since 2020 and her first as a mother at the U.S. Open, expressing relief at the achievement. Meanwhile, Amanda Anisimova achieved Wimbledon revenge by defeating Iga Swiatek, advancing in the tournament.

title: Newsmax Sues Fox News for Antitrust, Alleges Monopoly in Conservative Market
snippets: Right-wing TV news outlet Newsmax sued Fox News on antitrust grounds, alleging the conservative media powerhouse had illegally sought to suppress its smaller rival's growth in cable news.
Newsmax filed a lawsuit accusing conservative news giant Fox News of suppressing its right-leaning competitors.

Newsmax sues Fox News for allegedly abusing monopoly power
summary: Newsmax has filed an antitrust lawsuit against Fox News, accusing the larger conservative network of illegally trying to suppress its growth in the right-leaning cable news market. The suit claims Fox News is maintaining a monopoly in this sector.

title: Philips Hue Launches Major Update with Affordable Essentials Line at IFA
snippets: Philips Hue has announced the biggest revamp of its smart lighting line in years, introducing lower-cost lights, support for Matter over Thread, and a new generation of brighter light strips. The update includes the launch of a new Essentials line, motion-sensing technology across all Hue lights, an

Smart lighting company Philips Hue debuted a bunch of new products this week at the IFA tech show in Berlin, Germany, and most of them are available now. The launch, which is the biggest in the company’s history, includes cheaper smart lights, a new bridge for its Zigbee ecosystem, a redesigned line
titles: Philips Hue responds to cheaper competitors with major product overhaul
Philips Hue lights get bigger, brighter, and cheaper with a major product refresh
summary: Philips Hue unveiled its largest update in years at the IFA tech show in Berlin, introducing a more affordable Essentials line, support for Matter over Thread, brighter light strips, and motion-sensing technology. This revamp also features a new bridge for the Zigbee ecosystem. Most new products are available now.
